summary: This mod aims to make Skyrim more creepy and atmospheric with some new shaders.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][size=5]Skyrim Scaryshaded - the easy way to get Skyrim look creepy[/size]

[size=3]This mod uses[/size][color=#cc4125] [url=http://reshade.me]ReShade[/url] by Crosire[/color][/size] [size=4][size=3]and the[/size][color=#ffd966][url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn Shaderpack[/url] by Marty McFly[/color][/size].

[img]http://static-7.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/13639300-1431437247.jpg[/img]

[size=5]This mod has  [color=#ff0000]nearby no[/color] performance hit![/size]

[size=4]
[url=http://reshade.me]ReShade[/url] is a post-processing injector. If you get a good shaderpack like [url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn[/url], you can change a game's look and feel in just minutes with so many different effects to choose from, for example simple colour-changing effects, lighting-related shaders like Bloom or Godrays, image-enhancing effects like sharpen or SMAA and depth-effects like ambient occlusion and even Depth of Field!


[youtube]l6fLNzobJeU[/youtube]


As Reshade is still a Beta and it gets updated really quickly, I suggest checking [i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46925/?]here[/url][/i] every few week or so if you decide to use this mod. Also, don't forget to update [url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn.[/url]
Just go ahead and copy your old Mastereffect.h if you cannot remember your settings, install the new version by renaming ReShade32 to d3d9.dll and  copy/paste it in your Skyrim folder overwriting the old one. To update MasterEffect Reborn, copy/paste the MasterEffect Folder, ReShade.fx and Mastereffect.h files into your Skyrim folder, open Mastereffect.h and set the values to your liking.

The screenshots are taken with quite a few mods installed, but you can get similar results in less than 10 minutes.
The most important ones are:

[url=http://reshade.me]ReShade[/url] with the [url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn shaderpack
[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel
[/url]or
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52423/?]Pure Weather
[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX
o[/url]r
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul
[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076/?]Realistic Water Two[/url]
or
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1111/?]Pure Waters[/url]

and your favourite texture pack.
[/size]


[size=4][u][size=5]Installation: [/size]

mainly just like ENB:
[/u]1. Disable AA in the Launcher, set AF to your liking.
2. Go to steamapps\common\Skyrim[/size]
[size=4]3. Take the 3 files ( d3d9.dll; Mastereffect.h; ReShade.fx )[/size] [size=4]and copy/paste them into this folder.
4. Take the MasterEffect folder and drag/drop it into the same folder.[/size]
[size=4]5. Go to My Documents\My Games\Skyrim and open SkyrimPrefs.ini
6. Set this value: [center][size=4]
[Display]
bDefferredShadows=0[/size][/center][/size][size=4][size=4]7. Run the game.[/size]
8. Done![/size]

[size=4]NMM-installation is not possible.


If you want your shadows and water reflection to look a bit more ENB-like, there are several steps to do:

1. Install ELFX or RLO. I prefer ELFX because it makes things even darker, but that's your chioce.
2. Go to My Documents\My Games\Skyrim and open SkyrimPrefs.ini
3. Set these values:
[/size][center][size=4]
[Display]
iBlurDeferredShadowMask=5
iShadowMapResolutionSecondary=4096
iShadowMapResolutionPrimary=4096
iShadowMapResolutioin=4096

[Water]
iWaterReflectHight=1024
iWaterReflectWidth=1024[/size][/center][size=4]

4. Open Sykrim.ini in the same folder and set these values:

[/size][center][size=4][Display]
iShadowMapResolutionPrimary=4096
fSunShadowUpdateTime= 0.000
fSunUpdateThreshold=0.100
[/size][/center][size=4]You CAN set the shadow values higher, e.g. 6144 or 8192, but it can be quite a performance hit.[/size]
[size=4]I would not recommend cranking up the water reflections even higher as the effect doesn't scale with the performance hit.[/size]
[size=4]The last two ones are optional, they make your shadows a bit more 'dynamic'; they change position much more frequently.[/size]
[size=4]
[/size][size=4]
If you want a Deaph of Field-effect, I recommend [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12525/?]DYNAVISION[/url].
[/size][size=4]
[/size]

[size=5][u]Compatibility: [/u][/size]

[size=4]NOT compatable with ENBseries or SweetFX.
Every other mod should work just fine.


Don't forget to check out my other mod, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64889/?]Skyrim ReShaded[/url] for ENB-like graphics without a performance-hit.



[/size][u][size=5]Credits:[/size][/u]

[size=3]First things first: A HUGE Thank you!! to [url=http://reshade.me]Crosire[/url],
and, of course, also a big shoutout to [/size][url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread][size=3]Marty McFly[/size][/url] [size=3]for the shaderpack.[/size]
[size=4]You made this mod possible.[/size]
author: master6TheOriginal
